title: Competition is growing in the space-data-relay sector
summary: Companies reveal plans for optical and RF data relay networks to address growing demand from satellite operators for high-speed data transfer.

title: Speedcast nets first Starlink reseller deal for enterprise and maritime
summary: Remote communications provider Speedcast has become the first company to sign a distribution deal to resell SpaceX’s Starlink broadband services to enterprise and maritime customers.

title: Slingshot Aerospace rolls out free space-traffic control service
summary: Slingshot Aerospace, a space data analytics company, announced Sept. 13 it is offering a free version of its space traffic control software to satellite operators

title: Artemis 1 launch plans slip again
summary: Days after NASA proposed to make its next attempt to launch the Artemis 1 mission on Sept. 23, the agency changed course and pushed back the launch.

title: Redwire and Sodern to cooperate on star tracker
summary: Redwire and Sodern announced a partnership Sept. 12 where Redwire will produce in the U.S. a version of a Sodern star tracker.

title: ESA seeks major funding increase at ministerial
summary: ESA will seek a roughly 25% increase in funding from member states this fall despite economic and geopolitical challenges in Europe.

title: Ground teams trying to regain control of scouting satellite for NASA’s Artemis moon program
summary: Ground teams will try to stabilize the motion of NASA’s small CAPSTONE scouting satellite and rescue the $30 million mission on the way to the moon, following a problem Sept. 8 that sent the spacecraft into a tumble and caused controllers to temporarily lose contact with the probe, officials said Monday.

title: Georgia, Illinois Students to Hear from Space Station Astronauts
summary: Students from Georgia and Illinois will have the opportunity this week to hear from astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Eutelsat and OneWeb consider second-generation LEO plans
summary: OneWeb is considering plans for a second-generation constellation jointly with Eutelsat ahead of closing their proposed merger, executives for the satellite operators said Sept. 12.

title: Blue Origin capsule escapes rocket failure on uncrewed flight over Texas
summary: The suborbital rocket developed by Jeff Bezos’s space company Blue Origin suffered its first launch failure Monday, when the main engine on the New Shepard booster appeared to cut out about a minute after liftoff from West Texas. The crew capsule, which carried NASA experiments but no people, safely landed under parachutes after firing an abort motor to escape the stricken booster.
